title: Radiation Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Very well structured interview. The questions were behavioral based and the interviewers were very supportive throughout the process. It was pretty much like other interviews I have encountered. Really not bad.
Interview Questions: Think of a time when you had to deal with someone /Something controversial and how did you handle it?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: They call you in and ask you some questions. There is also a peer interview on the phone and drug test that you must complete. It's relaxed; when you come in you usually get a tour of the facility. It's definitely helpful to have a reference.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working in a team environment?

title: Clinical Exercise Physiologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the director of the program on the first day and then went to shadow him on a patient interview. The second day is a shadowing experience with the exercise physiologist treating patients and then a formal peer group interview with the senior employees.
Interview Questions: How do you work with someone who isn't being cooperative

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Very good they are very attentive and goal oriented and want you to Excel in your career they will ask how you do under pressure and in certain screening questions
Interview Questions: What do you do if you don’t like a coworker

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen with hiring manager asking about experience and why you are interested in the position In person interview Shadow experience same day or whenever works for you and staffing Offer from HR
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Asks past job experience questions Why you’re interested in research Relaxed A lot of information on Job duties Regular interview questions Tour the facility Meet the other colleagues Tell about yourself
Interview Questions: What are you interested in research?

title: Palliative Care Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: After the application process, there was a phone interview with the director. The next step was peer interview with the team, including another social worker and physician. The interview was scheduled in person at the hospital.
Interview Questions: Questions about personal and professional self-care

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: it was a quick interview process over the computer on Microsoft teams and they asked basic interview questions based on their values. A quick response time with offer after the interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself Where do you see yourself in five years A time you and a coworker disagreed

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through UPMC career portal. Had an initial phone interview with the IT manager, then a teams interview with the manager and a couple team members, followed by an in person meet the team interview.
Interview Questions: How do you approach client’s needs, issues, and complaints.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward questions, about 1 hour long Zoom call with unit manager after talking with recruiter on the phone, questions were mostly situational based on previous experiences. Overall had a smooth experience with technology and scheduling the interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you responded to an angry customer.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Harrisburg, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Great processes for interviewing and follow up. Apply online and HR will get back to you. The process from application to hire is about 1 month. Benefits are great for new nurses. Lots of opportunity to advance and change departments.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very informative. Like almost a hour long very comfortable. Ask about experience and past jobs. Basically making sure you are the correct candidate for the position that you are applying to.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this hospital?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Washington, PA)
Interview Descriptions: My interview went very well even though I didn’t get the position. The hiring manager was kind and was transparent about what experience they were looking for and shared more about the job.
Interview Questions: How many years of sales experience do you have?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Very nice. Things flowed relatively well. We’re very direct in what type of person they were looking to hire and their expectations for the person taking over the new role.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: First there was an Online application submitted. Then a detailed followed up with call and then scheduled an interview to meet in person with one other interviewer it was not bad at all.
Interview Questions: What was my last work experoence

title: UX/Visual Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: This was a 3 step interview process (video via Microsoft Teams). 1st: Initial phone screen, 2nd: video interview, 3rd: final video interview + design challenge. The whole process took about a month.
Interview Questions: Design challenge, walk us through (speaking out loud) this website and provide feedback and tell us what you would do differently.

title: FMR Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Long and drawn out. 3 steps, took over 2 months and then got an automated rejection email 2 days after final interview. No real person even contacted me after they decided I wasn’t the right fit.
Interview Questions: All interview questions were basic STAR questions.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Camp Hill, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was relaxed and easy. Had an interview with HR and then with a a manger. Just told me about the job responsibilities and asked a couple of questions about myself. Heard back very quickly
Interview Questions: What my strengths and weaknesses are?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: A number of pre-set questions where you feel like you never have a good answer unless you happen to have been in the situation they're asking about. For one I gave a more conceptual answer and then they asked for something more specific about my experience in that situation (which I had never been in). Otherwise, pretty straightforward. Interviewed with a number of people from the team.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you had to think outside the box at work.

title: Cafe Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy and relaxed. Standard questions and they answered every question I had. Manager was very nice. The woman who did initial phone screen was very nice as well!
Interview Questions: Describe a situation at your previous job that you struggled with and how did you overcome this.

title: Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous interview process. Is more of a matter of best fit if your interests and the company's interests align with regards to programs or what they see the position growing into.
Interview Questions: Why UPMC What programs specifically interest you Why should we pick you out of all the candidates

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Nurse manager was nice and kind. Helped describe the unit and hospital services. Scheduling benefits and layout of the floor working on at that time. The new icu gator and stepdown unit and how they operate.
Interview Questions: Strength and weakness and rotating floors

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: skype style interview. Had two interviews. Very pleasant. Very quick response. Answered all my questions. The manager was very flexible with my schedule as well. The one thing I don't like is how they explain the insurance benefits. It's a little confusing
Interview Questions: Why I would want to work for them

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Pretty intense. Straight to the point with difficult questions. Sat in an office with supervisor and literally just answered, what seemed like, the same questions about former employment. Was approximately 45 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a coworker and how did you take steps to resolve it?

title: Health Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Easy! A phone interview followed by a teams interview followed by a job offer that same week. I was offered more than I anticipated. There does seem to be a lot of movement within the company of supervisory staff.
Interview Questions: What are you most proud of?

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: I was ghosted by 3 different departments. Even after reaching out to thank the interviewers for their time, they did not have the decency to tel me that they had moved forward with other candidates.
Interview Questions: 1. UPMC values 2. Generic HR questions opposed to those relevant to the position I was interviewing for.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was good, not too difficult. It was via Zoom and it was comfortable. The manager was who interviewed me. The interview in total was about 30-45 minutes long I believe.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: It was a rather straightforward marketing interview and questions...nothing crazy. A lot of situational questions such as describing a time when something went wrong in a campaign and how you overcame it.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when something went wrong in a campaign and how you overcame it.

title: Orthopedic Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Altoona, PA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview panel did not seem engaged or enthused at all. Entire interview lasted no longer than 20 minutes. Left encounter wondering if I did or said anything to put them off.
Interview Questions: We are looking for a self-starter for this position who will take the initiative to take care of business. How do you think you would do working independently?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. It focused on company values and how you would react in certain situations. It also focused on your scheduling and availability, but I think this depends on whether or not you are part time or full time
Interview Questions: How do you deal with unhappy patients

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was an in-person one on one interview followed up by a secondary interview with 2 other staff members. There was no initial phone screening. She described the work environment to me and explained that UPMC has a specific set of situational questions they need to ask.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to think outside of the box to complete a task?

title: Patient & Family Support Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: A brief phone screening with AA asking what hours I would be available and what experience I had that felt aligned with the role. At that time on on one teams interview with department manager scheduled. After interview with department manager, second interview was scheduled a few days later with peers in the department.
Interview Questions: Name a time you feel like there was difficulty in understanding a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The 1st interview is typically with the unit manager/director. If you were successful in that interview, then there is a peer interview next. After the peer interview, they emailed me to come shadow the floor. After the shadow day, it took 2 weeks for them to call and extend me the offer!
Interview Questions: They ask about UPMC’s values and how you’ve applied them in the work force.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Okay but this is highly dependent upon management as you can imagine. Good lads though but subjective. I’m sure it’s so I’m sure the majority are from my native country and the rest are from the south.
Interview Questions: What are your thoughts about this or that?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UPMC (Cumberland, MD) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Too easy, very rushed, seemed like they just wanted to hire to fill the position. I met with 4 different people and it was very repetitive. Benefits package was minimal and pay wasn’t the greatest
Interview Questions: There was 3 questions that were very basic

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Lancaster, PA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was quite a lengthy process. First was a virtual meeting with the hiring manager, then a virtual peer to peer interview and lastly an in person meeting with the physicians of the location. From first contact to offer it was about 5 weeks.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of scenario questions pertaining to issues you would potentially be faced with day to day.

title: Doctor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: This was a typical interview. The employer and committee asked questions and wrote down my responses. They gave me scenarios and I had to tell them what I would do.
Interview Questions: How are you doing today?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Easy. I applied and got a call within a week or two. Set up and interview and heard back within 2 weeks. The staff is easy going, and asks questions based on UPMC core values.
Interview Questions: When was a time you saw a coworker doing something they shouldn’t have been and how did you handle the situation?

title: Contact Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview. It was personable. I tried to be relaxed and relatable. It may also depend on the interviewer and prescreen that happens before they decide if they’d like to interview you for a position.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience that relates to the position you’ve applied for?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UPMC (Harrisburg, PA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: 4 people asking very difficult questions. The core values of Upmc. For example, they would ask a question about each value listed. Quality & Safety: We create a safe environment where quality is our guiding principle. Dignity & Respect: We treat all individuals with dignity and respect. Caring and Listening: We listen to and care for our patients, our health plan members, our fellow employees, our physicians, and our community. Responsibility & Integrity: We perform our work with the highest level of responsibility and integrity. Excellence & Innovation: We think creatively and build excellence into everything that we do.
Interview Questions: Quality & Safety: We create a safe environment where quality is our guiding principle Name a time when you had to use quality and safety and what did you do.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 nurses from the education department interviewing me. They started with basic questions like why did you want to become a nurse, what made you interested in this job. They asked what are qualities of a manager that you do not like and qualities that you do like.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose St. Margarets over other UPMC hospitals?

title: HR Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: First was a hire-vue, then a second interview on zoom with three leaders, then a final interview! The questions asked were mostly behavioral, although some STAR based questions were also asked.
Interview Questions: Why HR? Why UPMC? Give a weakness

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on Zoom with the PI and lab manager. They started with the interview questions, and then asked if I had any questions. They then described the study I would be working on. The whole process was 1 interview and providing references.
Interview Questions: The interview process contained very standard questions, things like what is your greatest weakness, when is a time you went above and beyond for work, describe a time you disagreed with a boss or coworker, etc.

title: Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Interview was via Zoom and was very low-key. However, during the interview I realized that the location listed in the description was incorrect. The actual location was 40 minutes away which made me decline the offer ultimately.
Interview Questions: What do you know about this position?

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: easy , you just apply online then they will contact you, you will either have interviews through phone. call or face to face. Two nurses will interview you and give you a rotation at the hospital just to see how it looks like
Interview Questions: behavioral interview where you are asked what you would do if faced with a situation in a work place

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with wide range of questions from specific to system-wide view. Asked about perception of the company from an exterior candidate, which led to a good discussion of internal perception and the direction they wanted to take the team. Overall very good experience.
Interview Questions: What is your perception of UPMC?

title: Mental Health Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easygoing, and the person who emailed me was so kind. She was accommodating to a virtual interview since I was away at college. The interview was quick and very easy!
Interview Questions: They gave a scenario and asked what we would to do handle that situation

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Email Invite, Interview with Manager, Peer Interview, Offer. The process was very smooth. Everything was virtual, which made the process go a lot quicker. didn't have to worry about not being able to get to an interview on time
Interview Questions: How would you ensure that you are obtaining top-talent?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions:
Questions were situational 
What is your Best quality and worst quality 
Describe a time you had to work under pressure
What can you contribute to the team
Describe a time you had conflict with a co worker
Interview Questions:
Questions were situational 
What is your Best quality and worst quality 
Describe a time you had to work under pressure
What can you contribute to the team
Describe a time you had conflict with a co worker

title: Internal Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: It started with a recorded interview process where you answered a few questions and submitted. Then I met with the team and had a Teams interview.  I was contacted by HR within the week letting me know that I had received an offer for the position.
Interview Questions: How my experience was with an internal intranet system.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pitts, PA)
Interview Descriptions: straight forward and simple. I had the initial interview and then met with other members on the team that I would be working with and then later met with the director.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Oncology Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Quick hiring process and constant communication with recruiter. General interview with tell me about a time questions and review of your resume and skills. This was a standard nursing interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time...

title: Cloud Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy process, heavy focus on the principles of SaaS, IaaS and PaaS. Having Microsoft Azure Certifications are definitely a plus if you're interviewing, as well as experience with PowerShell
Interview Questions: Give us an example in which you utilized automation to make a manual process more efficient.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: They call and email to set up in-person interviews. Satisfactory experience with staff, they are knowledgeable and can answer any questions. Nothing was left to the imagination if the communication flows.
Interview Questions: Salary requirements, and job experience.

title: Business Intelligence Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers clearly never read my resume. Then asked questions about if I had certain skills and experiences even though I had never listed those on my resume. If they had read my resume, they would have known the answer. It's a waste of time to talk to people who clearly have no interest in me as a candidate. Stop wasting candidates' time if you have no interest in hiring them.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with SAS?

title: Training Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: I first received a phone call discussing the position, so that I was aware of what the position entailed. After that, I received e-mail communication to come in for an in person interview. Very easy interview process. Questions about equality and diversity.
Interview Questions: What does equality and diversity in the workplace mean to you?

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. You are asked basic questions that anyone should be able to answer (lots of situational questions ie. what would you do in this situation/how would you handle it/relevant questions to position.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had to diffuse a situation.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: three tier process starting with a one way video interview, then leading into a panel interview with potential work colleagues, then moving on to supervisors and direct reports for the final interview.
Interview Questions: Q: describe a time when you were challenged in a workplace.

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by email for an in person interview. The questions were simple and experience based. A few weeks later they called and offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult customer.

title: Clinical Fellow - Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great and I have no complaints. They asked questions such as what got me interested in the field, past clinical experiences, and what I am looking for in an ideal position.
Interview Questions: What got you interested in the field

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Quality questions and leadership placement. I was asked to describe situations where I found myself in difficult situations and how I best handled them or how I overcame working as a group.
Interview Questions: How I show leadership in my workplace

title: Accounting and Finance Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Confusing to someone accustomed to a clean, organized structured interview process. Disjointed at times, some nice people and some different ones, no consistency in message about the role or responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Didn’t really ask. Talked at me and asked about my background.

title: PA-C Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: relaxed and more of a conversation. It started with a phone interview. 2nd was an interview with two of the lead doctors and two other members of the management team. Then another interview with everyone from the APP time.
Interview Questions: describe a dangerous situation you were in and what you did to avoid a negative outcome

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Took a while to hear back. Went through two rounds of interviews and then never heard anything back after giving salary request.  It was a few months before I got the sorry, someone else was selected email.
Interview Questions: Why was I looking to leave my current employer

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward- they truly want to get to know you and make sure you are the best fit. Be ready to explain your prior experience to them and know your resume
Interview Questions: Explain a difficult situation you were in and how you went about handling it

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with behavioral questions and job-specific questions, as well as reference checks. The behavioral interview was lengthy but the job specific part was not. I spoke with the project coordinators and the PI.
Interview Questions: What drew you to this position?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview and in person interview . Pretty standard process, and was completed in a timely manner.

Offer came within a few days after completion of the process. Little negotiation of salary.
Interview Questions: Cover past experience and relevance to role.

title: Clinical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pitts, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with manager and supervisor. Interview is very professional but not stressful to me. One of the question was " What is your experience which related to the job requirement? "
Interview Questions: What is your experience which related to the job requirement?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: It was not avoid, I think I was expecting better from such a good healthcare company. I think it's all about favoritism and hiring people who are not qualified and show discrimination is common
Interview Questions: Previous experience or any related past job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview. They mainly asked behavioral questions typical in all nursing interviews and explained about the unit being interviewed for. 
Questions were introduction, previous job experiences, strengths & weakness, conflicts, etc.
I was at ease with these questions and straight-forward with my answers recalling past jobs and clinical experiences.
Interview Questions: A time you had a conflict with a co-worker & what was the outcome?

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The typical interview process is 2 steps. the initial round and the full panel round. the initial round lsats about 30 mins and the full panel lasts between 1:30 to 2 hrs.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years.

title: Information Technology Residency Program (ITRP) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: There was a pre-interview conversation with a current member of the program which went very well. During the main interview, it did not seem like anyone was interested in interviewing me from the start.
Interview Questions: What does your career path look like?

title: Sr. Safety Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Standard initial phone interview, then a virtual interview with two Managers, then a final person interview with a panel of peers, and a site tour. Then explained parking options, if hired.
Interview Questions: Hypothetical Industrial Hygiene situation question.

title: Environmental Service Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I felt good and respected I had an interview bye two nurses at two different upmc  hospitals the interview was at energy innovation center they made me not feel nervous they were very nice and  I did get excepted into the job program I start March 28th can't wait this job will be good for me compared to the River Casnio
Interview Questions: Explain a little about your job history?

title: FMR Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a one way interview with you answering questions with no feedback. After that, I did a virtual interview through Microsoft Teams. The final interview was in the office in Forbes Tower.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and easy to get through. The need for nursing/nurses aids is so high right now. I worked casually which was nice because I was able to make it work with my class schedule.
Interview Questions: Upmc values so review these

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Quick and to the point. Interviewer was clearly working on strengthening their structure and cohesiveness in the work environment.  Multiple job openings were interviewed for within the same unit, and I was given the chance to explore all options.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5  years from now?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a chill 30-minute Zoom call. The person interviewing me was nice and asked me basic questions about my career goals and what experience I had for the position. They also asked a question about my resume.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself and why you applied for this position?
Do you have experience in lab techniques, such as PCR and Western Blotting?

title: Safety Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview with UPMC started with a phone screen followed by Teams interview, concluding with an onsite interview and a site tour. The team that I interviewed with was very nice and did a great job at making me feel comfortable with the process and was very open and casual on a few of the topics. A few questions turned into group discussions which was very pleasant.
Interview Questions: Q: What makes you interested in working for UPMC and the healthcare field.

title: Co-ordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
First interview: fairly informal, asked situational questions. The process took about 45 mins and the interviewer was personable. 
The issue was no contact from UPMC after the interview. That is unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Describe dealing with a difficult situation

title: RN Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a team. Standard interview questions with situational awareness.  Interview was approximately 40 minutes.  Received a call back with 2 business days with an offer.  Unfortunately the salary was extremely low compared to competing companies for Care Management. Attempted to negotiate up but was hit with a limit. I was approximately $12 less an hour than what I was currently making.
Interview Questions: Give an example when you went above and beyond in your position.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview is team-based as different staff members from the unit you are applying for will ask you questions and place their input if you are a good fit for the unit. The second step is then meeting with the unit manager.
Interview Questions: Discuss a difficult patient situation and how you dealt with it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick process. Peer interview panel. Appropriate questions. Welcoming to new grads. Opportunities for advanced education and advancement. Calls and emails returned quickly.  Given opportunity to ask questions about position and training programs
Interview Questions: How do I handle difficult situations

title: Credentialing Analyst Interview

title: Financial Analyst Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Castle Shannon, PA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
There were 3 interview steps in total. 1 with the team lead, the 2nd with the team lead and the Director of the team and, the forth with the CFO of the entire department.

It’s a shame because the interviews went really well, point where I thought I was going to get an offer. After I talked to the CFO. I was told I would get a response soon. You would figure that even if I didn’t get the offer I would get some kind of courtesy call or email to tell me that I didn’t get the position. And I would have like to know why so I can avoid making any similar mistake in the future, but I had to find out by myself going to the job application page.  I sent an email to ask why I was removed out of consideration for the job and received no response still. 

The interview process as was great and comfortable but the post interview response is an overall down negative.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Pre-Interview screening is completed by artificial intelligence. Great candidates are overlooked! This tool is so bad. Qualified great candidates are rejected before any manager is even made aware that a great candidate has applied. This is a very poor system
Interview Questions: No interview questions. The process used to screen potential candidates is very bad. I am familiar with several very qualified people that never got passed the artificial intelligence screening tool that is used.

title: Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Great, well organized interview process. Moved through process quickly.  Everything was scheduled quickly and the team followed up with me with an offer very quickly. I was able to follow along with the process on the careers site.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UPMC in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a RN position and heard back from the clinical manager within a couple days to set up an interview for the following day and she was insistent that I shadow following the interview. The interview was not with her, but with her RN coordinator. Again, all of the staff was wonderful and very friendly. Compared to the previous interviews I’ve had, this one felt the most accommodating. She asked the typical behavioral based questions, very organized, and very personable. I felt the interview went fairly well, although she did ask if I had children, which was a question I’ve never been asked in a professional interview before. After the interview the RN coordinator asked about shadowing and that I could stay as long as I liked; I stayed for a few hours because there was a lot to see and spoke with several staff members, even speaking with a newer hire on orientation who raved about the position. Overall, I felt really good about how the whole process went because the RN I was following made me feel like I was already on orientation. I was really surprised to find that I was quickly removed from consideration by the next day, with the position still posted. Clearly they felt I was not the right fit. It would really be helpful if they communicated decisions just to better understand what they were looking for in a new hire., but I understand with multiple candidates that can be time consuming.
Interview Questions:
What was the best job you’ve ever had?
Describe your best manager and your worst.

title: Intern Interview

I checked my application about a week later, and found that I was removed from consideration the day of my in-person interview. I am not sure why I wasn't told after my interview that they weren't going to choose me if they knew that day. I reached out to interviewer to say thank you and asked for some advice on what I could do better next time, never received a response.

Everyone was friendly and I was led to believe she truly wanted to hire me. Really played me. I get home to find within 20 minutes I was eliminated. It was like a sick joke. I’m very qualified, well spoken, dress well and very present and able to start asap.

Just a brief phone interview would have been sufficient, the five questions were very standard and nothing unusual, but this particular process felt practically abusive.

Once all three were in the office or on the call they began to ask me questions regarding my IT knowledge and skillsets.  Overall the experience was above average.
Interview Questions: What is your highest education level achieved.

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Was mostly relationship related and experience related. Experience related to types of scans and system experience. After the interview I was called within 2 weeks with an pffer. I did not accept the position. Pay is not good
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physical Therapy Clinic Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interviews with two managers and the final interview with VP. The interviews were very nice, but at the end they chose an internal candidate, which seemed to be the plan all along and I felt like it was an enormous waste of time. They also belittled my experience and questioned if I was qualified enough (but then proceeded to take me the entire way through the interview process?? If I wasn't qualified, then I should have never continued through. And, spoiler alert, I was qualified as I had currently been working as  facility director for an OP clinic for 7 years.
Interview Questions: Prior experience and  how I handled management of people

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pitts, PA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fast process. Reviewed resumes quickly and got teams interview fast. Lots of resources to help and HR quickly reached out. Interviewer was courteous and kind, and even when virtual it felt very personable.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a difficult patient and how you handled it

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The Interview was short - manager was very busy working the floor. Many interruptions and distractions. Minimal behavioral questions. Manager was unorganized and didn't follow the normal interview questionnaire sheet
Interview Questions:
Why  do you want to work the ED
What are your goals

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: I first submitted my  resume and then was asked to complete a virtual one way interview. This consisted of 10 prompts. I then was asked to the next step to do an interview with the managers in the department.
Interview Questions: What set Upmc apart from competitors

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and had an initial interview on Microsoft Teams with upper level staff. Then had a second interview with a panel of social workers later that week. Second interview was a little bit more laid back and there were more opportunities to ask questions about the position.
Interview Questions:
How would you respond to a patient who feels upset in an acute care setting and provide an example?
What core value of UPMC do you align with most?
How would past supervisors describe you?

title: Neuroscience Unit Staff RN & Interim Stroke RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, did the video call, then called into for an in person interview with 2 other nurses from the floor. Good communication and heard back 2 weeks after. Asked about 10 questions and it was laid back
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: It was bad. They are not nice people. I would not work for this company. They don’t seem to care about their employees. The interview process was also long. Didn’t hear back about an interview for several months
Interview Questions: How long have you been working

title: LTSS Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by a recruiter. Then contacted by emails to virtual events and after event interview was scheduled. Interview was short and simple. Described myself and my experience and answered situational questions that were asked by the facilitator.
Interview Questions: Why you wanted to do the job.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very brief and through Microsoft teams. My camera was on but theirs wasn't. It consisted of the unit director describing the unit and job. She asked a few questions about where I had clinical experiences in school then she asked multiple situational questions.
Interview Questions:
Q: What do you do when you have free time during a shift?
Q: What does a successful job look like to you and how do you measure it?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Had two interviews, one with a recruiter and one with direct management.

Each interview where a month apart, so there was a long wait time to hear back.

The first interview was very short because it was a screening interview.
Interview Questions: One interview question was, what was your experience with big event planning?

title: HR Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview questions related to role. Interactive process providing detailed information on position. First round may be with Talent Acquisition or may be one way virtual interview replying to questions on line via video.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UPMC

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions:
First interview went very well! I met with the supervisor and he asked me a series of questions. 
I moved on to peer interviews which was ridiculous. There were 4 people and they all seemed annoyed to be there. Every question was negative and not about experience or what I offer to the job. Two of them never even made eye contact and one of them answered their phone in the middle of the interview. 
I was told I would hear back in a few days but never heard anything. I emailed the supervisor that interviewed me to check-in on the status of the position and never got a response.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you couldn’t meet a goal and why?

title: Physician, Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview with head of section of hospital medicine, then separate interviews with 2-3 other hospitalist at upmc. Interview was not hard, mainly them answering all of your questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in UPMC?

title: Cardiologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Very organized and smooth  interview process at university of p I t t s b g u r g h  medical center. Nice faculty members.  O r g a n i s e d interview process
Interview Questions: Just a General assessment of personality.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The interview process seemed to take forever but wasn't too harsh. Too many different interviews. First need to interview with HR. Then with the department director. Then with the department peer.
Interview Questions: How would handle a situation where another employee did not get a long with you?

title: Rehabilitation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from my current supervisor asking me a few basic questions to see if i was suited for the job. Such as making sure I could handle the locations and workload. We then set up a Zoom interview. A few days after the zoom interview she brought me in to look at the facility. Soon after I was told I got the position via email.
Interview Questions:
A time you had a difficult patient.

If a patient has different views than you how do you handle that?

title: Student Nurse Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and simple. The interviewers really wanted to get to know you as a person and as a future nurse as they know you are still learning. It was an overall great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us what your plans are after graduation.

title: Procurement Operation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing was very nice and seemed to be passionate about what she was doing. Were relatively  easy questions that did not require too much intense thought.  Overall hardest part was some questions were relatively generic.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strengths

title: Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial hirevue asking basic questions that you would expect from an interview. I was emailed by the recruiter for a final interview (over zoom). There were about 5 board members on the zoom call and it was very conversational. The only question I can remember is them asking me why I'd like to work for UPMC. Other than that, they asked about my resume and what I'm interested in. They also asked me to talk about an experience that is not on my resume. Everyone on the panel was so nice and easy to talk to. The conversation flowed easily and was an overall great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about something that is not on your resume.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview questions were developed based off of UPMC's core values, to see how interviewee reactions/responses to different situations line up with values of Quality & Safety, Dignity & Respect, Caring & Listening, Responsibility & Integrity, and Excellence & Innovation.
Interview Questions: Describe a recent mistake you have made and how you handled it.

title: Data Anaylst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews: was given a chunk of data to analyze; presented in front of hiring manager and then the director; it was initially a group interview, no behavioral questions were asked
Interview Questions:
Analyze this data in anyway you want
Why did you chose this method?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth, they got back to me quickly after I applied. I felt comfortable the whole time. They emailed me to let me know that I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at UPMC

title: Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was 2 rounds, the first was a one-way interview where they record your answers.  The second was with 3 UPMC employees and was more behavioral.  Overall, it was very enjoyable and not stressful.
Interview Questions: What I am involved with on campus?

title: Contact Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was great. the woman was very nice. she gave a lot of info about the job. i was nervous for no reason. she had very easy questions. we ended up talking about our kids
Interview Questions: why do i want to work there

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had to go through 4 interviews, mostly 1 on 1s, with directors and seniors analysts. They were a half hour to an hour each. Pretty typical questions and nothing too difficult since I have good experience that relates well to this new position. In the end I did not accept the offer because they offered a salary lower than what I currently  make. When I told the person in HR that, she said she would go back to the hiring manager and see what they could do.  She came back with a slightly higher offer, still lower than my current salary, so I turned it down. It doesn’t make sense to leave a good job for less than a 10 to 15 percent raise, especially when I’ve had much higher offers. Know your worth and don’t let upmc lowball you. The posted salary range for the position was in the range I was looking for, so I know they could offer me more.
Interview Questions:
What do you do when you have a new dataset?
What is your QA process?
Explain a time when there was a conflict during a project. How did you work through it? What was the result?
What's your approach when learning new software?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Allentown, PA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was through and video screen consisted of several team members. They were all respectful and easy to talk too and allowed many times to ask questions. Still waiting to hear back regarding the interview/position
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Reaseach Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: It is a 5-1 interview, a sensior tech manager and a data engineer mainly ask me some tech questions. We talked about my background and previous projects. Very relaxing and enjoyable. It's a good interview

title: Administrative Resident Interview

Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time you went above and beyond.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Phone call, interview with unit director, then peer interview. Question that stumped me were “what’s a time you had to think outside of the box”. They ask questions about how you handle conflict, how you would prioritize certain tasks, and why you want to work for them.
Interview Questions: A time you went above and beyond for a patient/customer

title: Financial Analyst Interview

Was then asked in for an in-person interview with the same people. This lasted about 30 minutes. Felt confident about my chances, but was contacted by the hiring manager two weeks later with the rejection. Did appreciate the direct correspondence.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that may translate well into this position?

title: Physical Therapy/Rehab Aide Interview

Interview Questions: Describe a time when you experienced conflict, and how did you handle it?

title: Industrial Engineering Co-Op Interview

Interview Descriptions: The process was initiated by the co-op office of our University. Then a phone screening was scheduled as per our convenience. It went on smoothly. The questions were mostly technical stuff from my past work experiences

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview relating to UPMC core values. Lasted maybe an hour, video with unit director. One interview before offered was made. The whole hiring process was quick and painless, mainly dealt with human resources.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had a difficult patient.

title: Staff RN Interview

title: CSR Interview

Interview Descriptions: I Applied, I got a Interview, I was Offered the job and then I took a Drug test. It was a smooth process , And I was kept up to date On everything .
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with irate customers

title: Analyst Interview

A recruiter reached to me on Linkedin
Entire Process took 3 weeks from initial contact
Round 1: Phone screen with Hiring Manager(30 mins)
Round 2: Presentation and Q & A with  Technical Team (2 hrs)
Round 3: Phone screen with 2 scientists (1 hr)
Round 4:  Phone screen with Hiring Manager (30 mins)

Two round interview

First Round: Phone Call - Behavioral questions and questions on testing experience

Second Round: Video Call- Technical Round.
Mostly on Selenium, SQL and some testing procedure questions
Interview Questions:
Explain the framework you used in previous project.
Different types of waits used

First round with Development and QA manager. They were asking general behavioral kind of questions which normally Managers or Hr's ask.
Second round was technical interview with QA lead. It was Skype interview for a contracting position and later they converted it to full time.
Interview Questions:
Questions were around Java script basics (Loops, arrays, strings, Json) and Output of few already written code. And basics of selenium.
Basics of performance testing.

Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for UPMC?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and very friendly. Really depends on the nurses interview you but they just want to see you have the drive to learn. I had never cared for patients before but wanted to try and they gave me that opportunity.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in health care?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview

January 29th I attended an in person interview which lasted 1.5 hours.  Monday February 3rd I was contacted to setup a peer interview which I attended on February 4th.  This lasted roughly a half hour and consisted of current Help Desk personnel asking me templated questions.  February 13th I received an email letting me know that the position had been filled.  I did not receive an offer.

title: Financial Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: Long and very detailed  as  meeting with 5 staff members went through all items listed on my resume. Many questions very thorough asked detail of every response asked about work experience and college

title: EpicCare Training Team Interview

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2020

title: COORDINATION of BENEFITS SPECIALIST Interview

title: PT Interview

Interview Descriptions: very through, intense process; lots of hoops to jump through. very long background check process.  Overall, a good learning experience. Would definitely recommend you be ready for it.

title: Coder I Interview

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Cumberland, MD) in Dec 2019

Applied online.  Received phone call for follow-up interview

Interview Questions: Typical "your experience to do the job" questions

title: Resident Physician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Welcoming and yet thorough. Every interviewer was friendly and professional. I was interviewed by enough people to get a good feel for the department. Overall, they are a cohesive and well run group.
Interview Questions: What is PM&R?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: There is an over the phone interview, followed up by an in peson. You are only interviewed once for this position and then you will hear from their recruiter if you are offered a position. It may take up to several weeks.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager and director were friendly but inquisitive. They asked a myriad of personal and professional  based questions before sending me on to a “peer” interview. Each interview lasted approximately 1 hour.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job online and was called within a few days. Fairly easy interview process and great people to talk with. It was a great experience but decided against the offer and wanted to explore more options. The salary seems a bit low.

title: Marketing Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line.  I received an email request for a one way on line interview.  I could do the interview any time within 72 hours of receiving the email. Set up computer for proper lighting, background and microphone volume.  The interview consisted of a few questions. For each question you would read it and then the computer would start to record your answer in 30 seconds.  One recording only, there was not an option for redos.  The interview turned out fine, but the process was uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.  What do you know about UPMC. Specific job questions.

title: Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and fun! I started with an online application with a behavioral quiz, a video interview, then a final interview in Pittsburgh. Everyone is very helpful and they want you to succeed,
Interview Questions: What are three goals you have set for yourself and how did you achieve them?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: was contacted by a recruiter for a phone screen. after thescreen was offered i interview for the next week.  3 days late was offered another interview for same position diferent departments. the interview was behavioral and lasted  30 minutes. asked if I wanted to shadow
Interview Questions: rate my time management from 1 to 5

title: PM Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Applied the position through networking and interviewed with hiring manager then SVP.  All standard questions but you really have to feel what the interviewers' personalities are and adjust your approach.
Interview Questions: What are you not?

title: Psychologist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Often there is a phone screening first. Then you are invited to meet with several people like other staff you will be working with, then the PI or supervisor. Usually lasts a couple of hours.
Interview Questions: If you have experience with the specific populations you would be working for

title: Campaign Marketing Manager Interview

title: Milieu Therapist Interview

Describe a time you have a conflict with a co-worker
Describe a time when you have to make a quick decision

title: Diagnostic Radiologic Technologist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Meet with the supervisor she explained the job and duties. Hours of the job. Call schedule and the training process. Tour of the facility and explanation of the benefits, 401k and vacation

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Harrisburg, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Call from HR…discussed job, salary was not aligned. I was perfectly clear. Recruited said they would reach out to hiring manager to confirm. Recruiter stated hiring manager not good with salary. Two weeks later got a call from admin assistant requesting interview. I thought they reconsidered the salary. Interview with hiring manager, went well. 7 weeks go by and I heard nothing. Had me back in for second round interview which went well, as I am leaving hiring manager said “When you come on board I will show you.” Seemed like everything was good. Two weeks went by, heard nothing, emailed recruiter who initially said no go on salary, recruiter responded with a generic “You were not selected email.” Sent follow up to hiring manager and team and got no response. Not a professional experience, disorganized group.
Interview Questions: STAR based.

title: Associate Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on the UPMC company website. I received a phone call from UPMC after a few weeks asking to set up an interview. The interview was very easy, some UPMC style behavioral questions followed by a sheet of paper with several simple SQL, C# and general programming questions. Be aware though, the paper quiz was probably was just the department I was interviewing for and not every software job at the company. I knew mostly everything with the exception of a few ASP.NET questions on the technical quiz, and I felt the interview went well, but I believe they went with a candidate with more experience with C# and the .NET framework.  I never received an offer which I was fine with, but they didn't even have the decency to give me a phone call or generic rejection email which I believe is very unprofessional. Seemed like overall friendly people, I just think UPMC's HR department is a mess. Make sure to check on their careers page to check the status of your application or you may be in the dark several weeks later wondering if they'll ever reply to you. If you didn't get the job, they probably won't.
Interview Questions: Entity relationship diagrams and placing various tables in first normal form, second normal form etc.

title: User Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
First phase is a phone interview. Basic, common phone interview and a brief high level review while on the phone. 

The next phase is an onsite in-person. This is generally about 3 hours long. The first part is meeting again with the same manager who did the phone interview for a more in depth portfolio review. The next step in this is meeting with, who I believe is, the director over all UX. Very easy and laid back. This is more of a conversation about the company culture and structure of the organization. You get a feeling that management is pretty relaxed. The next part is a design challenge. This is a bit more nerve racking as you'll be asked to solve a problem on the spot. They more or less want to see your thought process and how you took steps to arrive at a final solution. The final step is meeting the UX team. This can be where things go sour - as they did for me. 

Meeting the team was fairly relaxed and informal. It's strictly with the team and no manager in a closed room. However, there are individuals who have a "smarter than you" mentality and make it very difficult to answer questions without feeling like they are trying to flex their intelligence. This part of the interview process made me reconsider wanting to work at UPMC as I couldn't see having friction with the team and not feeling it was so competitive that I was going to be thrown under the bus constantly by someone who is trying to be more superior, or smarter, or whatever they need to prove to feel good about themselves. I've worked with a number of clients, stakeholders, and teams through my career and never have I felt such a negative vibe in a meeting  with a group of people. It's almost like they are forced to do it and they take advantage to talk down to the candidate. 

I ultimately declined their offer because of the team and the vibe of working with this team.
Interview Questions: They will want to know how you arrived at solutions for you portfolio projects, why you want to work for UPMC, and basically anything that deals with your on the spot thought process to problem solve.

Interview Descriptions: I met with two people and it was pretty simple. The first interviewer asked me standard questions and the second interviewer asked more “getting to know you” questions. It was overall a very easy interview.

When you check-in with HR, you are given a schedule consisting of various meetings and various areas you will be observing throughout the day (including a lunch break).

title: Academic Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for the position online and received an email offering a phone interview for the following week. Interview was approximately an hour long and went well, was invited in for an in-person interview approximately 3 weeks later. The in-person interview was around 2 hours long and involved a variety of repetitive interviews with a number of staff members. I was told I would hear back in 2 weeks. 

After 2.5 weeks passed, I sent a follow up email to which I didn’t receive a response for an additional week. (If you’re still following, that’s nearly a month after my in-person interview.) I was overjoyed to hear that I had received a second in-person interview! I was very excited about the position. The liaison for the position confirmed that she would get back to me after her long weekend so that we could set up a date and time.  I emailed her a few days after the long weekend and received no response. 

After 3 weeks of radio silence and no second interview, I was sent a form rejection letter from UPMC talent acquisition. That’s nearly 3 months, if you’re counting, and I was given the run around the whole time. I will never apply to another position at UPMC and will happily warn every person I know not to apply.
