I was asked standard interview question for the position that my school had prepared me for.  I also received credit for prior patient care that reflected in my salary.  I would recommend UPMC to new nurses.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?
Was there a time that you exceeded the standard? not the exact words
Was there a time that you had shortcomings? not the exact words

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: I got a video interview and had to take it within 3 days. I submitted the interview and they never got back to me. I had to reach out and find out if I got the position.
Interview Questions: What is something you can bring to this position?

title: Research Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Entire process took over a year actually which is pretty comical. Was about to get an offer when I was told finding was on hold. They called back 5 months later with offer. I only took it for educational benefits, but ultimately I found the salary to be too low and found employment elsewhere.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to go into research? 
General conflict resolution type question. 
Strengths and weakness question.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my job applications online for three different nursing positions at different UPMC facilities. Human resource employees from each of the facilities contacted me about one business day later. At one hospital, for a bedside nursing job, I interviewed with a nursing director in-person once, and he asked me a list of questions from human resources, and then I met some of the other employees on the unit. At another hospital, for another bedside nursing job, I interviewed with a nursing director one time in her office. She started the interview by telling me about the unit, allowing me to ask questions, and then asking me questions from human resources. She gave me a brief tour of her unit. My third interview was for a research position. I interviewed with three managers simultaneously for different research jobs. The interview lasted about 35 minutes. They told me information about their different centers and the type of work. The interviewers allowed me to ask them questions. Then they asked me a list of questions from human resources.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time when you thought that a patient was being too demanding? Can you give me an example of when you went above and beyond for a patient? Tell me about a time when you disagreed with a team? Tell me about a time when you sacrificed quality for quantity? What is an example of how you follow instructions?

title: Mental Health Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job online. Was invited for an in person interview. Interview was very casual. Questions were more about the job than about me specifically. Was able to tour the facility and shadow at the interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview and an in person interview. Very easy, just assessing whether you're pleasant and mildly intelligent. Worst job on the planet EVER. If you get an offer, run.
Interview Questions: Describe the last time you were late for work.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to 5 individuals for over 5 hours. Spent 45 minutes with each interviewer. Had behavioral part with some employers. Other employers wanted to make sure I knew what they were working on and whether I was interested in that. Make sure you review each employer and what they do for a great conversation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked by yourself (ambiguity question)

title: Geriatric Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: responded to advertisement.  Schedule for interview by administrative assistant about two weeks later.  One on one interview with supervisor.   Comfortable conference room setting.  Easy to find building and parking
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Temporary Onboarding Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was completely overqualified for the position. I was excited about working for UPMC, but was told my eagerness was an issue. They were looking for someone more humble. I was completely taken off guard by this comment. I was just excited about the job, but apparently that is a bad thing when you are interviewing at UPMC. Also, they completely misunderstood my situation, and accused me of being disengaged because I didn't ask enough questions in my second interview, but the structure of the second interview (a job shadow) was kind of unusual and threw me off guard. The computer system they showed me and the process was all very straightforward and I didn't feel the need to ask a lot of questions because it's not a hard concept to grasp. She also accused me of rushing the hiring process because I mentioned that I did not have to give a 2 weeks notice from my current job. She didn't bother to ask me why and address her concerns. I just do not recommend working with this department. They dismissed my application for completely trivial and stupid reasons. I had a perfectly fine explanation for every issue she perceived with my candidacy, and I was basically LIED to in my interview because I asked my interviewer in both interviews if there was anything about my application or interview that she had concerns about so that I could address them and she told me that she had no concerns. SO DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME.
Interview Questions: They ask you a question about everyone of their "values" and ask for an example of how you have exemplify each of the values.

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Erie, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was typical for a corporate hospital. Required background check, clearances, drug testing, blood draw, and formal in-person interview with your direct superior as well as other staff members you will be working with indirectly.
Interview Questions: Tell us about an ethical dilemma you faced and how you resolved it.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Applied online and was called a few days later. Unit director asked me to shadow someone after interview. Then I was called by HR about a week later about a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you collaborated with others to achieve a goal?

title: ACABS Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Briefly meet with floor managers. I was asked typical interview questions. After initial interview was invited back for second day long (8 hours) interview. This is a shadow day interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at WPIC?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was not hired I just applied for an internship and I sent a video interview. The process took ages and ages to come to an end. They are an employer that takes you into consideration for ages and at the end comes with a rejection answer. This is not being correct with people. At least they should take the time to say sorry but we don't want you, in the same way, I took the time to fill pages and pages of their requirements. I will never apply for them again and hope all the people that had the same experience will not in the future.
Interview Questions: If you were in a desert isle what are three things that you would like to have with you?

title: Creative Arts Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I didn't get an interview.  The application didn't get to that level. It was rejected before even being considered. Furthermore, they rejectected the application with less than one hour review time, which makes me think that they didn't even consider my qualifications at all. I have experience voulunteering in music therapy, and am a professional musician. Those are skills that matched some of the prerequisites of the job. I also have a  B.A.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions asked.  Be prepared to interview with multiple people. Hours of work being offered not the best, but may work great for some people.   Overall decent experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me where you see yourself in 5 years

title: Legal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Video Interview that asked about four to five questions.  It gave you about 30 seconds to think of an answer and then about 1 minute and 30 seconds to reply to that answer.  If you messed up, you were not allowed to go back and edit your responses.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: RN Neuro Stroke Atloona Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UPMC (Altoona, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: casual and relaxed, the unit clinicians really made you feel like you were at home and shows you around the unit to give you the feel for everything. very informative. I got offered 2 jobs and chose neuro stroke because both of the clinicians were way more professional than the other floor.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for UPMC

title: Medical Records Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professionally handled. The interviewer was very kind and made me feel comfortable. I did not get an offer but the experience would not teture me from applying again.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with medical or keeping records?

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: it took a long time for me to hear back from anyone (about 2-3 months) I applied before I graduated luckily  but once I did it went pretty quickly with good communication
Interview Questions: Respiratory situational questions

title: Content Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted via LinkedIn directly by the hiring manager. We had a conversation over the phone and I decided to apply online. I then had a formal phone screening a week later by the same hiring manager. I was invited to come to Pittsburgh for an all day interview.
After a long morning of interviews (with roughly 7 individuals), I had to perform two writing assignments onsite. I was there from  approximately 9:15 - 5:15.  As part of the process, I also had to do an additional writing assignment at home. I had to return the assignment the same day it was assigned. 
I basically used a vacation day to drive 5 hours each way for this interview, ate lunch by myself in the cafeteria, and did a bunch of mind numbing writing for a job I wasn't even offered. Total waste of time and energy. After all the time and effort I put into this interview process, the icing on the cake is that the hiring manager, who I had spoken to multiple times  at length throughout this process, couldn't even reach out to personally let me know that I wasn't being selected for the position. Instead I get a note from a recruiter, with whom I have had no prior contact with, to inform me of this outcome (and this is only after I sent a follow-up note to the hiring manager asking if a decision had been made). Totally unprofessional if you ask me.
Interview Questions: Name a challenge at work you've had to overcome and how did you manage it?

title: Associate Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had an in person interview and then a phone interview since the other team members weren't present for the initial in person interview. They were nice and it was a fairly decent interviewing process.
Interview Questions: What was your role in a team?

title: Summer Supply Chain Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1) Met recruiters at my school's career/internship fairs 
2) Did a recorded interview at home (answering questions with no interviewer)
3) Went downtown to do an in-person interview
4) Heard from them about 1 month later
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions (Why UPMC? / Why Supply Chain?)

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Completed an online application. I then received a phone call one week later to set up interview the following week.  For the interview I met with two supervisors and went through an hour worth of questions.  I then had a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Nurse Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy interview process. It took about a month between interviewing and negotiating salary to close the deal. Because it's a big Corporation there are many stages and a lot of people involved in the interview process. Don't expect an offer after the first interview. There are also background checks which take time and salary negotiations which go back and forth.
Interview Questions: How  would you handle conflict with a coworker?

title: Medical Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
Informal, low stress.  Applied through ERAS and had a response in one month.  They do not pay for hotel or travel.  
Typical EM interview day.  The best part of the trip is being with the EM residents at the dinner the night before.
Interview Questions: What is your interest in Pittsburgh?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with brief questions. Then a Assessment for 90 minutes. And if you pass that then you get a FACE to FACE interview. The in person was kind of challenging. Interviewed by 3 different people. They had a packet of questions to ask so please practice and be prepared. Overall it was a Normal Interview
Interview Questions:
Name a time you dealt with angry customers?
What skills are needed to perform this job?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from the Project manager, 3 weeks after applying online. Had two rounds of interview, one with the manager and two team members. The first interview was more behavioral and little technical. The second interview was more technical with 4 team members and manager. Although my interview went well I received a call from HR after 2 months with rejection.  After that, I received an email from the project manager saying,  although they had to take another candidate with more experience, she was really impressed by my interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: They start the process with a values assessment and video interview. They then have final round interviews in person. There are two panels of about three executives each. They want you to know about their company, their values and their goals. This shows how much they really care about this mission. This is a behavioral and not a technical interview.
Interview Questions: what is leadership to you

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application online. Completed an skype interview by recording myself answering questions read on screen. Interviewed in person in front of a board of employees about my experiences so far.
Interview Questions: Difficult patient?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received a phone screen, and was set up for an in-person interview at the South Side office.  My interviewer was pleasant, and it was one-on-one but not too formal, more of a conversation. I ultimately turned it down because it required traveling to every office in Pittsburgh until one office decided they liked you enough to say, and the offer was $13/hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond for a client.

title: Summer Associate - Employee Recruiting and Retention Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online application followed up by a one-way interview session. Was then selected for final round of interviews with corporate. Corporate interview consisted of a panel style with 3 members of the HR team interviewing me at once.
Interview Questions: If you had to describe HR to someone who didn't know what HR was, how would you describe it?

title: Inside Sales Department Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: There weren't any technical/coding questions, just questions about soft skills and experience. We had an online one-way video interview and then an on-site interview with two panels of 6 people. (If you're a guy, wear a suit, because there will be some people there who have to dress up every day, even if that's not what you'll experience in the workplace.)
Interview Questions: Sorry, I don't believe in sharing interview questions. You'll be fine.

title: Social Worker Bsw Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was over the phone. All the questions were behavioral / situational questions. Such as , tell me about a time you went above and beyond. Tell me about a time you handled a difficult situation. I then received a phone call from the hospital HR department scheduling a face-to-face interview. The face to face interview was more of a conversation. Explained about the position and gave me and opportunity to ask questions.  Only maybe two behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you dealt with an angry client/patient.

title: Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was for a finance internship.  Applied online in August, and had the interview 1 month later.  One way video interview that lasted about 15 minutes and included 7 questions.
Interview Questions: If you were stranded on a deserted island what 2 items would you take?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The next week I received a call to set up a phone interview, which we had set for 2 days later. The phone interview day came around and I received no call, so that night I called the interviewee and left a message that I never received my phone interview. The next morning she called and apologized up and down for missing it, she had gotten sick. It happens. So we scheduled it for the next day. Did the phone interview and then had to do an assessment test as the next part of the process. Did that 2 days after the phone interview. Then another 2 days passed and I received a call for a face to face interview, that was set for about a week later. The face to face interview went really well, I was interviewed by 4 different people, one at a time. There was only one other person who had an interview at roughly the same time as me but she was actually late. She was interviewed first and it lasted about a half hour. Mine lasted about an hour. I got the call the following Monday with the job offer. I'm currently in the process now of completing the background check and health assessment test.
Interview Questions:
They asked me all situational questions like: Describe a time where you had to multitask, how did you handle it, and what was the end result? 
Stuff like that.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UPMC in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email invitation for a phone interview 3 days later.  Scheduled the next available appointment. Received an email confirmation including the name of the person, who would contact me. Two days later an additional email reminder was send to me before the interview. I looked forward to the opportunity but the call never happened. I was left waiting. No one ever called or emailed me to reschedule or to tell me that the position was filled. I called them several times but was send to leave a voice message every time. I also emailed them but neither my calls nor my emails were ever answered. It was a very frustrating experience, especially with the call center being unable to connect me and consistently sending me to an answering machine. Hopefully, I was just unlucky and other candidates have better experiences because regardless of how busy someone gets, I think it's just plain rude not to cancel a confirmed appointment.
Interview Questions: No questions asked. I was initially contacted and scheduled but never called for the interview.

title: Finance Management Rotation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Super friendly.  I had an interview with one of the current FMRs first. Then I went into the interview with HR and management. There were five interviewers who asked mostly stuff about my resume. Be yourself!
Interview Questions: Why UPMC and why FMR?

title: Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and did a recorded interview.  I found this kind of odd talking to a computer and just recording myself and think I would've done better talking to a real person.  There were seven questions, you have 30 seconds to read the question then about 1-2 minutes to record your answer.  You have one chance for each answer and cannot re-record.
Interview Questions: If you were stranded on a desert island what two things would you want to have in your backpack?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview of 6 or 7 (around 2017), nice faculty. I feel like they just wanted to get to know me and I got a chance to informally meet and talk with the residents on two occasions without attendings -- that showed me that the program was not hiding anything.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in their area?

These people don't even have maturity that hobbies are some ones personal choice. Over all Disgusting Interview.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2017

Interview Descriptions: Its In-Person Interview with 3 member panel. The manager, leader and one optional candidate from their team . Very Disgusting questions and satires from this team. Interview Questions:
1. Do you play Poker in u r office
2. What are you hobbies , so that we can joke.
3. This is just a time pass interview, seriously this job is not open.

title: Patient Information Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job Monday July 10, did my phone interview Thursday July 13th. I was asked at the end of the phone interview to come in for a face-to-face interview. The phone interviews questions were just about my previous experience & availability. My face to face interview was scheduled for Wednesday July 19th. I interviewed with the department manager. She asked me a couple standard interview questions, tell me about a time when this happened. The following day, i received my offer email & someone from recruiting with an offer. He said that within a few days I'd be getting another email on how to access my onboarding portal, it took a little longer than normal to receive though. Once I did that, I scheduled my Pre employment screening, did a background check, drug test & I have to get cpr certified. My official start date will be Monday August 14th.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you and a coworker had a disagreement and how did you handle it ?

title: Sustainability Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UPMC in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by HR after applying through Linkedin.
Very professional about setting up a time for the first round phone interview
Interviewer was very warm and  asked me basic behavioral questions and questions focused around my Resume.
Interview Questions: Why Healthcare Industry ?

title: Patient Care Technician-CDU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial phone interview and was told immediately that I would have an additional interview in person. Two weeks later (after I followed up with my interviewer) I was scheduled for the face to face interview. One week later I went to the unit which had a professional, yet relaxed atmosphere. I was asked to schedule a shadow experience after the discussion. I chose to bring scrubs with me in order to shadow on the same day. After shadowing, they suggested I wait two to three weeks before expecting an answer. Two weeks from then, I was offered the position as is. No negotiations, even though the pay rate was lower than posted on the original position application.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work for UPMC?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Initial telephone interview went well and immediately told would have face to face. Brought onsite for interviews with leadership. Half of the interviews were very awkward. One openly criticized the "boss", another complained about their job and was very flustered and negative. Unprofessional environment and it was clear the leadership group did not function in a team approach. (So I knew immediately this wasn't the right fit for me).  Felt like one person was trying to ask me questions specifically to challenge me, but not in a positive way. For a leadership role with extensive interview investment, I found it unprofessional that UPMC does not send out a formal regret for candidates put thru the selection process who were no longer being considered.  I expected professionalism from this academic center and it wasn't there.
Interview Questions: Difference between leadership and management; tell me about the steps you talk to solve a problem; a few people were condescending in how they posed their questions during the interviews.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Applied in early January. Was contacted for a phone interview within a few days and scheduled for it a week later. After phone interview I was asked to compete a 90 minute online assessment. Was contacted the next day and set up an in-person interview for the end of January. I talked to three different people at the in-person interview and was told I would hear something within two weeks. I thought every step of the process went well but I received a rejection email a month later.
Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses

title: Systems Analyst - Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about 35 minutes, all of the members in the interview panel were very personable people.  They asked a lot of questions in a rotating fashion about my interest in the field and what all I knew about it.
Interview Questions: What different databases are you familiar with?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Altoona, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have to go through a phone interview first which took me about 30 mins. Then you get called if you did well for a on the site interview. Took about 45 mins. If that goes well usually within a week you get a call for a job offer then it takes about a month to get started.
Interview Questions: My employment history.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Farrell, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I waited two months to receive an email invitation for a phone interview. The interviewer liked me and offered me a face-to-face interview. He told me to bring scrubs to shadow. The interview was very impersonal. She did not ask me anything about myself or my values; just situational questions read off the computer. She did not ask me to shadow and told me I would receive a call about an offer or lack thereof. I received no such call.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you did the right thing.

title: Patient Information Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with general availability questions and customer service phone screen too about 15 minutes.. Face to face with interviewer took about 20 minutes. Lots of situational questions. Pretty easy interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult customer, how did you handle it?

title: Actuarial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Half hour campus interview with one of the managers, followed by a 3-4 hour on-site interview with the whole team. Had one-on-one time with all managers and the chief actuary, as well as interviews with 2-3 other analysts at a time.
Interview Questions: mix of behavioral and technical/work experience

title: Social Worker Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied, my status was changed to "In consideration" online the next day. 25 days later it changes to "Not in consideration" so i don't think I have a chance.  A half hour after seeing that I am no longer being considered for the job, I get a call for an interview (please note the job had been posted since late December and I applied late February). When I go in to the interview I am blown away with how unfit I am for the position and how inaccurate the job posting was. They were seeking qualifications, certifications and experience for the actual position that was nowhere on the job posting or my resume and application. I am stumped on how I even got an interview and how misleading the job posting was. What a mess, and a complete waste of time. It's unfortunate. If the posting had indeed been accurate, I would have been a top candidate for and excelled in that position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; questions about therapeutic approaches; why should I hire you

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I felt that this interview process was unnecessarily slow as well as non-communicative after the interview was over. The person interviewing didn't seem to know much about the position and  didn't provide me with any next steps.
Interview Questions: Why should you be selected for this position?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 panel of people interviewing-they were administrators not peers . very  basic questions.  Asked about situations, experience, coping with stress .not memorable- as just the average interview ans they want to see how you present yourself.
Interview Questions: Describe a hard situation that I dealt with

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: standard phone screen process, if your resume does not have specific words you will not be considered. very basic questions. not difficult at all. took maybe 30 minutes. took forever to receive any communication at all
Interview Questions: Strengths?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very thorough process. I got to meet the whole team. Unfortunately we were not a good fit for each other. It was a work in interview that lasted more than one day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Therapeutic Staff Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with the director of the wraparound program and discussed my qualifications as well as the fact that the program was relatively new and getting up and running a bit too quickly.
Interview Questions: what was my degree in

title: Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Really friendly, easy-going phone interview with VP of operations. Asked very general, standard behavioral questions. Things like: "tell me about yourself, what do expect to get out of the program, strengths/weaknesses"
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Once i applied for the job in UPMC, I received a phone call and they called me for face to face.
I had interview with three people.One was manager and other two where Team leads. they tested how I was talking and my behavioral. they mostly was concerned about the behavioral.
Interview Questions: Basic Ba questions

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Took three months to hear anything. Passed intial phone interview  but did not get the job. Went into a group interview where we got a tour of one of the possible units we could be chosen for.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses

title: Partial Hospitalization Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screening was as expected and lasted 15 minutes. First face to face was easy and straight forward. Second face to face was awkward and aggressive (i.e. informed me she "didn't take any sh*t". Group interview was chaotic and involved multiple people (12 interviewers!) with strange (occasionally illegal) questions that were irrelevant to position.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about garden gnomes?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: First round was a telephone interview with HR.  They described the job to ensure I understood what was required then asked a few questions. First few questions were about my employment history then they went into some behavioral/situational questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict with a customer.  How did you resolve it.

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Seven Fields, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Simple 1:1 interview, basic interview questions. The interview was conducted by the Supervisor for the department and they were ready to make a determination immediately. This allowed me to be prepared for the future. The job offer (verbal) came in within 10 minutes of the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions. Nothing stood out as it was that rote and predictable. No behavioral questions were asked.

title: Health Promotion Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UPMC (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview was done by a Talent Acquisition team member.  All questions were along the lines of how did you handle yourself in certain situations professionally, how did you take a process and make it better etc. etc.  If you pass this initial phone interview you will be passed on to the Hiring Manager who may or may not contact you for an interview.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you noticed something a colleague was doing that was inappropriate or unethical (something to that effect) and how did you handle it?

title: Crisis Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first completed a phone interview with HR where I was read a list of questions to answer. This interview was very scripted and rigid. I was contacted about a week later for a personal interview with dept. director. I attended the interview and was asked the same list of questions that I already answered for HR. This interview was much more personable and informative of specifics of the position.
Interview Questions: Have you had a situation where you had to deal with a difficult consumer and how did you handle the situation.

title: Insurance Verification Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Crafton, PA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took a month to get called.  Very easy interview but mgr said the position I applied for was posted incorrectly and said she was looking to fill a CSS position and she felt I was a great fit. Def not what I applied for but she said pay scale was the same?  So it took almost 3 months ,no joke, to get a denial notification. In the interim I applied and interviewed for this same position, after I verified the posting was correct, at another location. This mgr was unkept and had a filthy office. She read straight from a paper and showed no interest in being there that day. Then I noticed negative comments she had written on the back of my resume that came from the other mgr I interviewed with. So unprofessional and surprising given how  much she complimented me and felt I was a "good fit". I assume she was intimidated.  Anyway, Not sure why the 2nd mgr even bothered to call me in, in the time it took me to get home (15 min) she already moved me to "not in consideration". As soon as I got the notification email, I immediately called her and advised I was aware (despite my degree, recent Insurance specialist job,  and 16 years of medical mgt experience) and simply thanked her for the opportunity. One of us had to be professional after all.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in a position here?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was first given a phone interview with HR and then was brought into the unit I applied to for an interview with the unit director. Straightforward! After I was given an offer I had to do training which was, let's be honest pretty boring but that's how it goes.
Interview Questions: The questions were your typical interview questions: Tell me about a time you were a leader, had a conflict at work, showed initiative, etc.

title: Creative Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Full day of interviews with HR, Marketing Leaders, Agency and Internal Creative Department Staff. I met for 45 minutes to an hour with each. I was dropped off at the cafeteria for a half hour break to have lunch by myself, with directions to the next conference room/meeting. That was disappointing. The view was amazing! I enjoyed the meetings but, I don't have much experience with the healthcare/insurance industry and I spent more time asking general questions (probably a mistake in hindsight).
Interview Questions: How I would organize the volume of work for various departments and seasonal/function deadlines for selling and choosing health care

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by an admin to schedule the interview.  The interview process consisted of a one hour face to face discussion with the principal supervisors in the project/department.  Most of the interview seemed to include a synopsis of the interviewer's department and their functions as it related to their current project.
Interview Questions: They asked typical HR questions, including experiences, scenarios and self reflection.

title: Professional Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Emailed by nursing recruiter to set up interview with unit director. Interviewed with unit director. Followed up with nursing recruiter and accepted offer from nursing recruiter approximately 3 weeks after interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult patient or family member? How did you overcome this and how do you think you could have dealt with it better?

title: Kitchen Steward Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process involved a simple phone screen inquiring as to my current job status, what I was looking for (full- or part-time), as well as an in-person interview afterwards. There was also an employee health screening before my hire date.
Interview Questions: How would you react if you were to deliver food to a patient with a poor outcome, and there are family members around them?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UPMC in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  A recruiter contacted me the next day to set up an in person interview.  I interviewed the next week.  The interview was with one of their software engineers and the recruiter.  The software engineer asked me questions about my resume/previous projects as well as some OOP questions while the recruiter recorded my answers.  I was then asked to write a fizz buzz program on a whiteboard.
Interview Questions: What are three elements of OOP?

title: Provider Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone interview about 1 week after I applied.  I went for an face-to-face interview about a week later, and received an offer about 2 weeks later
Interview Questions: Do you have any customer service experience.

title: Health Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Received an e-mail asking to schedule a phone discussion of approx 30 minutes for 2 contract position I applied to.
Spoke with lady for about 15-20 minutes. Explained it was a govt. contract position at both locations. No way to read interviewer and was not asked many questions beyond why I wanted to work there. I was able to relocate quickly as needed - perhaps they wanted someone younger and closer. Hard to know. Was a bit concerned about the nature of a one year contract that was not assured of renewal. Said they would resorb the position if it were not renewed. Sounded fair in theory - but vague as to the specifics. 
I did not get either position and got a rejection email stating the usual "we decided to pursue another candidate" fare and wishing good luck. 
Sad because this would have been a good fit in my opinion. Ran my own business for man years. In grad school now with 4.0
I suppose when the phone interviewer says "we plan to contact people next week if we decide to move forward with the interview process" should have been an indicator that I was not to be on that list.
So disappointing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Do you have F2F interaction with clients?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: first there was a phone interview with human resources and then upmc set up a onsite interview with the manager and lead technician. upon arrival i interview with the manager, lead technician, lead pharmacist and another pharmacist. the interview process lasted around 6 to 8 hours and some asked normal interview questions from a list and others told me what the job consisted of.
Interview Questions: why did i want to work at upmc

title: Contact Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first completed a phone interview and was then invited to an in person interview. The interview was with one supervisor asking a variety of the typical questions. After that, I was given more information about the position. The interviewer left to talk to HR and came back with an offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company?

title: Summer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions:
Light hearted, they want to get an understanding of your interests.
They try to match you with the manager that best suits you for the summer.
Had a phone screen then in person interview but they will make accommodations if you're out of state
Interview Questions: What is an experience dealing with a difficult customer and how did you overcome it?

title: Physical Therapist (Acute Care/IPR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Monroeville, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on-line.

2 weeks later, received phone call to meet for interview.

1 week later, met with Director of Rehab:
-Tour of hospital areas which are commonly used by therapists (patient rooms, gyms, etc...)
-1 on 1 interview with Director of Rehab.
-Meeting and interview process took ~1 hour.

2-3 weeks later, received a phone call with job offer.
Interview Questions:
Began with job description, hours of work, and description of rehab staffing.

Several common "life experience" questions:
Tell me about a time when you had conflict with a supervisor?
Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond what was expected of you?
Was there ever a time when a customer or client was dissatisfied and how did you remedy the situation?

Then 2-3 situational and job specific questions:
Would you be comfortable treating and working with a patient alone in an acute setting?
What are some things you would look for or do before performing a patient evaluation?

Ended with opportunity for me to ask questions.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews and then was brought in for another 3 interviews in person.  I withdrew myself from the process after the interview.  The director was very abrasive and unprofessional imo.  I had 20 years of experience and he asked me what extra curricular activities I did in college?  I felt like I was interviewing for a job fresh out of college not a Sr. role.  It was not a good cultural fit for me.
Interview Questions: What process do you use in communicating with hiring mangers and recruiters

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Oakmont, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted for a phone screening interview on 6/17/16 by a UPMC HR specialist. The interview was easy and brief, lasting about 30 minutes. My HR contact was personable and basically just asked me to elaborate on my resume, as well as a few very common behavioral questions (i.e. When was a time you had to deal with conflict at work and how did you resolve it?) At the end of the interview I was informed about various research positions I'd be a possible fit for and that she would forward my resume to them. She also gave me her e-mail address so that I could contact her if I never heard from any of the PI's. 

I was finally contacted for an in person interview at Western Psych on 7/11, and scheduled it for 7/15. I met with the PI, and two other research associates. Everyone was very friendly and gracious. The Interview was more conversational than formal, but they did have a mandated list of questions to ask. At the end of this interview the CRA who initially contacted me to come in promised to contact me in 2 weeks whether I got the job or not. 

I didn't end up getting the position, but the interviewer wrote me a very nice note explaining that i was a top candidate and will do well wherever my career leads me.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this specific study?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Months passed between application and initial contact from HR.  Phone screen with a hiring manager to discuss qualifications.  Was invited to the downtown office for an interview with multiple directors, and potential colleagues.  Took nearly a month to offer the job after that.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were faced with a technical/programming issue that you didn't know how to solve?

title: Heath Unit Coordinator/Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process, manager was very pleasant, unit staff was very easy to get along with! Came to the unit, met manager followed by her clinician, asked questions, went over job description in detail, expectations, wants & needs of the company. Toured the whole unit and introduced to staff - I also brought my scrubs with me; and manager was very impressed by that and my enthusiasm; which resulted in me being able to job shadow the same day.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time your work schedule interfered with your plans outside of work & how did you handle it?

title: Associate Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The staff were hypocritically friendly and corrupt, Nepotism at its finest. They hire either their relatives or internal candidates. I interviewed for 4 programming positions and I did well in all of them, yet not received an offer. Some of the hiring managers were honest by saying they went with an internal candidate. Some of the interviews, they already had a candidate in mind, they were just conducting interviews to follow guidelines 
I am done with UPMC. Corruption and nepotism is the summary of my experience.
Look else where. Don't let let them low ball you, don't let them get to you.
Interview Questions: Basic OOP questions

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UPMC (Pitts, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted the morning after submitting my resume and cover letter by a recruiter. I had an interview two days following the initial notification. The interview was only 15 minutes and was extremely routine. When it came time for me to ask questions at the end of the interview, I of course asked the day to day work and then what the position entails weekly. The recruiter had an abrupt attitude and said she does now know the specifics to that question. 

I understand as a recruiter you are calling A LOT or people daily, BUT you should have general knowledge of the position and the general work that potential employee will be doing. For an organization that prides itself in customer service...they don't really do what they preach.
Interview Questions:
They asked very specific questions about your tasks and experience. 
Ex) When did you have to overcome a struggle?
Ex) When did you have to work in a team atmosphere?
Ex) When was the last time you went above and beyond for customer service?

title: Supply Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: They just basically got to know me and told me the work schedule but over all the ppl was laid back which made me feel comfortable. Also they told me what I would be doing on the daily basis. From that point they told me that I will train in various areas in the warehouse to see where I best fit within the company.
Interview Questions:
What did you do on your last job. 
What is your availability.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Being that I was already on an assignment in the department, it was clear that I would be a good fit for the position.  I was interviewed by one individual who was privy to the work that I had previously performed for the division that thought I would be a great asset to her section.  At that time, I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Would I be willing to take the position?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their career website and was asked for an on site interview about 1-2 weeks later. The doctors were very nice, but the secretary was very unorganized. Despite that, the doctors were very patient and showed positive attitudes, and one of the two doctors told me that he would like to see me at the final round. The secretary said that I would be called in for the final round after consideration. However, I got no notice so I emailed her with no reply. She can make mistakes about scheduling, but ignoring my email is mildly annoying.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions, we mainly talked about my statistical and medical data research experience.

title: Interface Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. I met with the director for the first 15 minutes as a "get to know" you interview. They asked me a few questions about my background. I met with 2 members of the team for the last 45 minutes where they ask very simple behavioral based questions. I interviewed in April of 2016 and have yet to hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you handled a conflict between you and a team member

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview, followed by in-person interview. Process was quick and simple. My in person interview included two people in there asking questions. I asked a few questions in return which they seemed to appreciate. Took the job and still work there.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you had to resolve conflict between employees within your workplace.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First you will apply online at the company website, then your application goes directly to HR who will select the best fits to be forwarded on to the specific location at which your job is located.  Afterward, the supervisor will call for an interview if your resume appeals to them. 
 After your interview, if selected, HR will call with a salary offer.  Then you will have to undergo a health screening which can take a week or more depending on scheduling, and a background check.  Then you will complete orientation and begin work.  However, a lot of the time, anything other than entry level positions are posted with the intentions of filling them internally so you may not hear anything back at all.
Interview Questions: What is one challenge you faced that you have overcome?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: We had a phone interview followed by a face to face interview. After I passed that we met for a third and final time. It was narrowed down to just 2 people for the last one and I ended up with the job. The decision time took about 4 weeks to actually hear back from them.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I Did not get called for interview for 3  months application wa's completed. After initial interview, offer was made two weeks later for a start date a month out. Document verification process was very lengthy.
Interview Questions: What accomplishment are you most proud of.

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Mars, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, interview at corporate , interview with senior manager. With weeks in between the process, Then having to attend orientation which is a total waste and training in Pittsburgh in which you are not paid mileage and or parking.
Interview Questions: how do you handle a difficult co worker

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard. HR phone screening.  Proceeded to manager phone screen.  Face to face with manager and then director.  Offer made based on outcome of background check.  Whole process took 6 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time your had a disagreement with a peer, and how did you handle it?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UPMC in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I've one interview so far.  I was asked how my experience and personal achievements are in alignment with the five beliefs that UPMC employees should possess.  I was then provided a tour of the facility and educated on how a work day would be and how I would function as an integral role within the facility.  I should mention that this interview was for employment at a Assisted Living facility.  I just had the interview therefore I selected no offer since it will be a few days until I receive a call.
Interview Questions: How do you prefer to be recoginized forca job well done or recieve praise?

title: Provider Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for 3 different positions. I did phone screens for them first, then face to face interviews for all three positions next. The interviews were with the department managers at the interviews the direct manager would come in at the end and ask some standard questions.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot about my experience,  Be prepared to elaborate on your duties and skills from prior positions that are relevant to the job.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online and got a call from the department months later for an interview. I didn't have a phone interview which was nice. Process was very slow and HR is very incompetent
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to solve a conflict

title: UPMC Worksource Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process started with phone screening asking basic question on background and credentials. Then schedule in person interview for basic behavioral and skills questions. The questions asked where pretty basic and standard job experience background, from general talent acquisitions person. The position tasks and timelines also laid out, the next stage was going to the hiring manager to seek approval for the time availability I had listed and my qualifications.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had an issue at work and how did you handle it?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth/fast. I had applied for one business analyst interview position. I was emailed to set up an phone call interview, and once I was on the call, had a great connection with the interviewer. But because I didn't have enough experience facing clients - the position required face-to-face interactions with clients on a daily basis - I did not get the position. The interviewer however let me know he would refer me to another position, and soon after, I received a request to set up a phone interview for another business analyst position. The phone call went smoothly, and soon I was invited for an on-site interview. The on-site interview consisted of 3 sessions, one with two  client-facing members of the team, 2nd with two business analysts, and 3rd with the manager. 1st interview was behavioral, the 2nd more technical, and 3rd all-encompassing; the interview process was average in terms of difficulty and nice in terms of the swiftness.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with a difficult person on your team and how did you deal with it?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (D Lo, MS) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: what did you do , your good and bad situation, average, wait to call, phone screen first, problem solve, typing , computer software, handle problem, job seekers, hiring process, guideline
Interview Questions: what you think you fit this position

title: Human Resources Summer Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth, First was a phone interview and than if you got passed that you got to go in for a face to face meeting. They were simple questions but be  to sure you are ready to talk about yourself.
Interview Questions: How you lead people with different backgrounds that have to work in a group?

title: Quality Assurance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pitts, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: First part of process was a Phone Interview. The time spent with the conversation was around 20 minutes. The interviewer ask general questions - behavior and specifiques questions - background and previous use of technologies required. Also ask about pay scale.
Interview Questions:
Background
Technologies
Availability
Pay Scale

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions: Not too hard. Asked to whiteboard and talk through solution. Met with two separate teams and went through the same process with each. Management and recruiting don't really know where they will put people till after interviews so it is hard to gauge possible co-workers.
Interview Questions: Write fizz buzz code.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
One 30 minute phone or in-person interview
Health/Drug Test
10 hours of corporate brain-washing
Background check

To receive the offer, it took me 3 months after interviewing. Didn't start job training until 6 months after initial interview
Interview Questions:
Q: Give me examples of teams youve had to work in?
Q: Give me an example of a conflict you have had while working in a team?
Q: How did you deal with the conflict?

title: Housekeeper Interview

That was mostly about my prior work experience.

But it's agonizing to wait for them to call you back at all with any information. They were supposed to call me a few days before Christmas but it's January and I have never heard back. I called HR five times and left a few messages and no one has never answered me or called back. I've heard from other people that UPMC takes forever to do anything with applications and interviews. title: Senior Health Economics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at UPMC

Then things slowed down and I didn't get an offer letter till the beginning of May... HR was not answering my mails, it felt like I got the offer but I wasn't sure and they were not able to clarify anything. It was a very painful process after the last interview... title: Leave Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by the department manager a few weeks later. She contacted me over the weekend which was great because I didn't have to sneak around at my current job to return her phone call. She gave a detailed overview of the position and she threw out a few days/times that would work for an interview. I told her I'd get back to her on Monday. It took her until Wednesday to respond to my and didn't officially confirm my interview until the day before. She showed up late to my interview and answered emails while the 3 others I met with got to know me a little better. After the panel was done, I spent a few minutes with the manager. She asked my salary range and verified it on my application. Her response was "that's a problem". Someone didn't do their do-diligence in checking that prior to me coming in for an interview. It was a complete waste of everyone's time. I had been warned by several friends about working for UPMC prior to my interview but thought I would check it out myself. The people in the leave department seem great but the manager put a bad taste in my mouth with the lack of respect she had shown--showing up late, not dedicating time for my interview, not checking my salary requirements or raising the question sooner. Even if offered a position with UPMC, I would decline.

They asked the typical interview questions.

Tell me about the most challenging situation you've dealt with.

title: Patient Information Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions:
The Interview Process is VERY LONG.

1) You visit the UPMC careers website and submit an application to the Floater Pool for Patient Access Representatives. UPMC is always hiring patient access representativies (also called patient information coordinators) because people in this position tend to either get promoted after a year or two into a different role or leave the company all together.
2) Two weeks later, someone from HR will call you and have a phone interview with you. 
3) If the phone interview goes well, you will then have a face-to-face interview with a supervisor for the Floater Pool. 
3) If the second interview goes well, UPMC will go ahead and try to find a placement site for you. During the next three or more weeks, you get numerous calls from different UPMC facilities asking to interview you. At this point, you need to pray that you get placed soon because all of the traveling  and interview starts to get frustrating.

I went to three site interviews and I did very well. The only problem was I was over-qualified. I have a bachelor's degree with a lot of healthcare experience. People that take this job usually don't have  bachelor's degree and don't have a lot of work experience. After the third interview, I was offered a great position at another healthcare company and I decided to not proceed with the Floater Pool.

I think this would be a great position for someone that is looking for an entry-level position at UPMC and doesn't have much work experience or education. From there, you would work your way up in the UPMC healthcare system and eventually become a supervisor, manager, etc.
Interview Questions:
1) Why do you want to work in healthcare?
2) Do you have any hospital experience in scheduling patients and checking in/out patients?
3) You already have a lot of work experience in healthcare. Why do you decided to apply for this position?
4) Describe an instance in which you had to face a difficult patient or customer. How did you handle the situation?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first applied online multiple times for multiple jobs and finally got a call to schedule a phone interview for housekeeping at presby. I did my phone interview which was basically a run down of what was on my application and was invited to a group interview 2 weeks later. In between those two I also got a call for the same position at shadyside, I told them I was taking the offer at presby and they told me good luck and if that didnt work out to call them back. The group interview was interesting, we watch a video on customer service and then the two managers asked the six of us the same questions based on the video. Just smile and give good answers without copying what everyone else is saying. After the group interview as I was leaving one of the managers shook my hand and told me not to worry, that Id already got the job. A few days went by and I was called to schedule a final one on one interview. About a week later i went for the final interview and he said he knew he was going to offer me the job so he just gave me a run down of various duties. A few days later i scheduled a pre employment physical for about 2 weeks later. The physical involved a weight check, blood draw, pee test and a test to see if you can fit the duck bill masks. I started working about 2 weeks after that. Orientation is paid. All in all very long process but worth it because the pay and perks are better than everywhere else.

title: Patient Information Coordinator (Float Pool) Interview

Dependent on position, you need state, FBI fingerprinting, and child abuse clearances (which you pay for out of your own pocket).  In float pool, you will go to almost any UPMC facility (usually emergency departments or other departments that need a PIC) so be prepared to travel to East (in Monroeville) one day, to Cranberry the next.

title: Intermediate Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with recruiter. A few days later the recruiter called to ask whether I would be interested in an interview. I scheduled the interview with a secretary from the TDC. The interview was set up for the following week. It took place in a small room next to the waiting area. The itinerary was:

Interview I: 2 tech leads & 1 manager (30 - 45 minutes)
Interview II: 2 tech leads (30 - 45 minutes)

Interview I: asked a bunch of questions about my resume, accomplishments, goals, reason why I wanted to leave my current job. For the technical portion I was asked a lot of OOP questions, how to implement very basic things (not even as tough as reversing a string), and then I was asked a bunch of language-specific questions.

Interview II: asked a bunch of questions about my resume, accomplishments, goals, reason why I wanted to leave my current job. For the technical portion I was asked a lot of fundamental database questions and some specific questions about certain database systems (this may not apply to you. Our conversation naturally led down this path based on my previous experience).

I thought the first interview went well. One of the interviewers in the second interview was surly. So I wasn't certain how that would add up. The recruiter called me the following day to make an initial offer.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected. The most difficult part was explaining more complex parts of projects from my resume. Definitely spend time making sure your resume makes sense. You can search "tech interview" questions and basically any site will give you the answers needed for the tech questions.

title: Intermediate Software Engineer Interview

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UPMC (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring event at the Technology Development Center.  Interviews were a little odd.  First round was a 10 minute "lightning round", from there they'd choose people to go to round 2.  In the time between the two rounds, there were tours of the facility with some cool presentations on the work they're doing.  I wasn't selected for round 2,  but it wasn't the fact that I didn't advance that's leading to this negative review, it was my experience during the interview itself...

I'll skip around a bit and address the one positive point: The tour.  It was really informative and the people conducting the demos were great.  I had a good conversation with the guy who was running my tour and had the opportunity to talk about some of the things that they're working on related to both NLP and identifying gaps in services performed vs what was billed, we discussed how there appears to be an opportunity to tie the billing thing into supply chain.  All in all, the tour was a definitely a positive experience.

As for the 10 minute interview, while I have no doubt that my not being selected for the second round was entirely on me, there were a few things that really bothered me about how it was conducted.

First, I'd overheard one of the interviewers talking to another about trying to be "more intimidating".  I'd initially thought that they were kidding around, but both interviewers were relatively stone faced the entire time.  I'm not sure if the intent is to see how candidates perform under pressure, but I think it's counterproductive.  It is, after all, a candidate's first impression of potential coworkers or superiors.  It made me think that all subsequent encounters would be more challenge and confrontation than collaboration.

Secondly, the two people conducting the interviews only introduced themselves after I did and when they did, only gave their first names.  No titles or responsibilities.  I knew of one based on my research of the TDC prior to going, but I don't like the idea of having to give a pitch without at least some context around the audience.

The third problem I had -- and this was really the most irritating -- was that about midway through, one of the interviewers picked up their phone and appeared to start casually flipping through texts, emails, or whatever.  If you're only giving candidates ten minutes, give them the entire ten minutes.  I'll concede that I'm probably not the most interesting person in the world (as I mentioned, both interviewers were expressionless throughout the time I was in the room), but if you've truly lost interest and don't want to proceed, don't just tune out, end the interview.  I could respect that.  I wouldn't like it, but I'd respect it.  

After about an hour (during which time I went on the tour noted above) they announced the candidates who were selected for the next round.  As I mentioned, I wasn't selected.  There were some HR reps on hand to discuss other opportunities within UPMC for those folks like me who didn't move on.  The recruiter I spoke with told me that there are quite a few openings where my background in big data, analytics, etc... would be beneficial, but I absolutely have no interest in pursuing any other jobs at UPMC.

In summary,  the facility and the work that they're doing seem really great and appear to add real value, but based on those few minutes I spent in the interview, I've really soured on the UPMC brand.  In fact, I'm so annoyed over that phone thing that I've been mulling over getting a different PCP outside of their system.  I doubt I'll actually end up doing that, but let it serve to illustrate how utterly dissatisfied I am over the encounter:  I do not want to be their customer anymore.
Interview Questions: It was more of an opportunity to sell yourself for ten minutes with a few leading questions.  I tried to steer the conversation towards my experience in text mining but I wasn't able to work the room, so to speak.
